to.note: This link exists because of how Samus takes heatdamage while riding the elevator.
This link exists because of how Samus takes heatdamage while riding the elevator.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This runway is not usable if the PB blocks are broken.

strats.name: Fast Pillars Power Bomb Periphery Pirate Kill
note: The Power Bombs must be placed carefully to hit the Pirate without destroying the PB blocks.
This strat requires heatproof because it's pretty chaotic to execute.
This runway is not usable if the PB blocks are broken, but it also requires the Pirate to be taken out.
Some weapons have been excluded from suitless strats because they were judged to take too much time.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Just using the open end of this 0-tile runway does take some maneuvering time.

strats.name: Hjless
note: Destroying the obstacle isn't seen to take extra time for two reasons.
1- It destroys the shot blocks as well which are assumed to be manually destroyed each time since they respawn.
2- This assumes no jump assists, and some of the time loss of waiting for the PB is offset by having to setup for a pretty tight wall jump setup anyway.
It might bo slightly faster to do a stationary spinjump rather than the setup, but we won't go into that much detail.

strats.name: BlueSpace
note: This is considered faster than Space Screw becomes we can safely assume carried momentum from previous rooms.
The heat frame count is conservative and assumes only the speed of a 4-tap.

strats.name: Power Bomb Pillar Room (Left to Right)

to.note: Potentially doable with morph bombs and enough energy, maybe, but let's not go there

strats.name: Screw
note: Requires some spin canceling to avoid damage from Puromis.
It's pretty risky without Morph.
Avoiding acid damage at the last jump is tricky but possible.

strats.name: Power Bomb Pillar Room (Right to Left)
strats.note: Avoiding acid damage at the last jump is tricky but possible.

to.note: Potentially doable with morph bombs and enough energy, maybe, but let's not go there

rooms.name: The Worst Room In The Game

nodes.name: Cleared Bottom Junction
nodes.note: Represents being on the bottom platform with the pirates dead.

to.note: This link is for strats that don't require killing the pirates.

strats.name: HeatProof Pirates Kill
note: Being heatproof allows slower kill methods.
Morph bombs are still excluded because they take 30 bombs each and that's ridiculous.

strats.name: Power Bomb Pirates Kill + Bomb Blocks
note: It's not really possible to hit all enemies with double-PB hits while not taking damage.
Using Power Bomb Periphery is based on a strat that allows killing them and taking out the blocks with 4 PBs.
This calculation ends up taking 5, leaving a spare PB.

to.note: It's a one-way link because the way back goes 4 -> 2.

strats.name: Space Screw
strats.note: Space Jump without Screw will be another strat involving PBs.

to.note: It's a one-way link because the way back goes 4 -> 2.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Just using the open end of this 0-tile runway does take some maneuvering time.

runways.note: This longer runway requires taking out the Space Pirate.

enemies.name: Yellow Space Pirate (standing)
enemies.note: Technically you can get the drops but you likely won't

to.note: Without HiJump or any suit it can be done with Crystal Flash but will keep that out for now.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This longer runway's not usable if the shot blocks are destroyed.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This longer runway's not usable if the shot blocks are destroyed.

strats.name: HeatProof Kihunter Kill
strats.note: Assumes the first Kihunter gets dodged and not killed.

strats.name: HeatProof Run Through
strats.note: Most RNG patterns allow for 0 or 1 hits without weapon but some require 2 and a bit of extra time.

strats.name: Heat Run Through
strats.note: Most RNG patterns allow for 0 or 1 hits without weapon but some require 2 and a bit of extra time.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The KiHunters are much easier to avoid coming in from above, no need to kill them

strats.name: Power Bombs
note: FIXME This strat also unlocks node 2. Could add that in later?

strats.name: Red Kihunter Shaft X-Ray Clip
note: This requires Power Bombs because it saves neither energy nor ammo using Morph Bombs.
It's slower than Spring Ball mainly because X-Ray scope won't activate during the PB explosion.

nodes.name: Central Junction (Enemy dealt with)
nodes.note: This includes either having killed the Dessgeega or having iframes so you can leave without further damage.

nodes.name: Just Below Central Junction
nodes.note: This means being just below the central junction, before dealing with the Dessgeega.

nodes.name: Just Left of Central Junction
nodes.note: This means being just left of the central junction, before dealing with the Dessgeega.

to.note: this is a one-way link for the X-Ray climb, because it brings you to the left of the Dessgeega at the top.

strats.name: Base
note: It's not possible to reach node 3 without destroying obstacle B.
So no need to elaborate on how it can be destroyed from here and how many heat frames it would take.

obstacles.note: Morph Bombs excluded because that'd probably cost more health than just running through.

note: This expects that the PB gets used a bit before the node is actually reached.
This is why the full wait time isn't included in heat frames.

strats.name: HeatProof Kill
strats.note: Morph Bombs excluded because that'd probably cost more health than just running through.

to.note: No strat specifically for if the enemy is just dead, since all the different kill strats require nothing if it's already dead.

strats.name: Power Bombs
strats.note: This expects that the PB is used earlier, avoiding the need to wait for the blast.

strats.name: HeatProof Kill
strats.note: Morph Bombs excluded because that'd probably cost more health than just running through.

to.note: No strat specifically for if the enemy is just dead, since all the different kill strats require nothing if it's already dead.

strats.name: Avoid Hibashi
note: The hibashi hit can be avoided by waiting for the pillar to go up.
That requires the use of one PB and more time than is worth unless heat proof.

obstacles.note: Morph Bombs are not excluded here because there are consistent, safe setups for all Dessgeegas from this direction.

locks.note: The requirements for obstacle A are on the obstacle itself.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Just using the open end of this 0-tile runway does take some maneuvering time.

strats.name: Base
note: This runway requires killing the Dessgeegas closest to the door, and taking a Multiviola hit if the Multiviola is alive.
This strat doesn't actually clear obstacle E, but since we're leaving the room after it doesn't really matter.

unlockStrats.name: Kill 5 Multiviolas
note: The Multiviolas are far away and can't be killed from here, hence the local requirement of 'never'.
The only path through this room where killing them and leaving here would be meaningful would have passed through node 4 at some point.
So this strat is only doable by killing the Multiviolas when going 4 -> 6.

unlockStrats.name: Kill Bottom Left
unlockStrats.note: The obstacles have requirements of 'never' on the assumption that Samus travels to 7 or 6 and back to unlock the door.

note: In reality, any combination of 5 enemies will unlock the door.
But this room is way too complicated to try and track all possibilities.
We went with the two most plausible ones.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: Just using the open end of this 0-tile runway does take some maneuvering time.

nodes.name: Junction Below Bomb Blocks
nodes.note: Represents being below the bomb blocks, regardless of whether they are broken

nodes.name: Junction Below Bomb Blocks with Partial Bomb Block Break
nodes.note: Represents being below the bomb blocks with some bomb blocks broken, but not all

nodes.name: End of Bottom Hallway Junction
nodes.note: Position at the far right end of the bottom hallway

nodes.name: Junction Before Last Two Dessgeegas
nodes.note: Position to the left of the farthest two Dessgeegas

nodes.name: Junction Near Left Door After Multiviola
nodes.note: Right after the bottom left door, but after getting hit by the Multiviola nearby.

nodes.name: Junction Below Crumble Blocks, Set for Clip
nodes.note: This is below the crumble blocks, after getting a Multiviola in that chamber.

obstacles.name: Some Bomb Blocks
obstacles.note: Represents one set of bomb blocks from obstacle A, with the rest intact. So this obstacle is mutually exclusive with obstacle A.

obstacles.name: Runway Dessgeegas
obstacles.note: The 3 Dessgeegas closest to the left door

obstacles.name: Boxed-in Multiviolas
obstacles.note: The 5 Multiviolas in the Multiviola boxes

obstacles.name: Bottom Multiviolas
obstacles.note: The 2 Multiviolas in the bottom hallway

obstacles.name: Far Dessgeegas
obstacles.note: The 2 Dessgeegas farthest from the left door in the bottom hallway

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: More heat frames than shinespark frames because the shinespark bonk takes some time.

to.note: Direct link for SpeedBooster strats. Other strats should go 1-> 7-> 6.

strats.name: HiJump
strats.note: Requires one jump off a crumble block

strats.name: HiJump Springball
strats.note: Use SpringBall to just bounce on the crumble blocks.

strats.name: MidAir Spring Ball
strats.note: Requires one jump off a crumble block

strats.name: MickeyMouse Crumbleless MidAir Spring Ball
note: Doable by pausing early enough and starting laterla momentum before the pause.
The timing of the jump itself becomes very precise.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse Crumble Speedjump
note: Spinjump off a crumble block with just a tiny amount of run speed.
It has to be more speed than zero but less than what hits the first big height drop in the formula.
That gives just enough height to be able to walljump out.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse IBJ
note: This one's pretty horrible.
The shot block respawns quickly so it's pretty unforgiving on the IBJ executions.
On top of that, the IBJ is off a mid-air morph off a crumble block.

strats.name: Mickey Mouse SpringBall IBJ
strats.note: Shoot the block before starting or in mid-air, then use spring ball to bounce on the crumb blocks and start an IBJ.

strats.name: Power Bombs
note: This is done by positioning the Power Bomb far enough left to only partially clear the blocks.
Not sure if there's a way to get here and have the strat be relevant though?

strats.name: HeatProof Kill
strats.note: Considered killable with Power Beam without taking damage.

to.note: Options are to tank the damage or kill the Multiviolas. This is one-way because the way back requires setting up the ice clip.

strats.name: Iframe Blue Suit Run
strats.note: Taking damage off a Dessgeega at the far right, coming in from the top, allows you to charge a blue suit and get through to the door. It doesn't fully clear any one obstacle though.

strats.name: HeatProof Kill
strats.note: Morph Bombs excluded because there's no safe setup.

to.note: Options are to tank the damage or kill the Dessgeegas

strats.name: Setup Ice Clip

note: Ice is required because it's needed for the clip anyway.
It's relevant here because it two-shots Multiviolas.
The one hit is here as a safety, and is likely required if the Dessgeegas below aren't there yet.

strats.note: This is not just getting up there, but also bringing the correct Multiviola with you.

strats.name: Speed Through
note: If the Dessgeegas to the far right are killed, a short charge can get through.
To avoid redundancy, they must be killed by travelling between 7 and 6.

strats.name: HeatProof Kill

obstacles.note: Pretty much any weapon but PowerBeam and Morph Bombs can kill the Multiviolas in time to not take a hit.

note: Some weapons are very slow and require use of the safe spot above node 6.
This is why the Dessgeegas to the right must already be dead.
Morph Bombs are excluded because there is no safe setup.

to.note: Options are to tank the damage or kill the Dessgeegas and Multiviolas
Options are to tank the damage or kill the Dessgeegas. No heatproof strats because it's less damage to run to the safe spot above 6 and kill them from there.

strats.name: Plasma Wave Kill Sparing Multiviolas
note: Sparing the Multiviolas is required to perform an ice clip further in.
However, it requires going slower.

strats.name: Plasma Kill Sparing Multiviolas
note: Sparing the Multiviolas is required to perform an ice clip further in.
However, it requires going slower.

strats.name: Missiles Kill Sparing Multiviolas
note: Sparing the Multiviolas is required to perform an ice clip further in.
However, it requires going slower.

strats.name: Supers Kill Sparing Multiviolas
note: Sparing the Multiviolas is required to perform an ice clip further in.
However, it requires going slower.

strats.name: Screw Kill Sparing Multiviolas
strats.note: You can't catch the Multiviolas to kill them with Screw without reaching node 6.

to.note: Options are to Speed Booster dash or spark through, tank the damage, kill the Dessgeegas and Multiviolas, or go slower to spare the Multiviolas. No heatproof strats because it's less damage to run to the safe spot above 6 and lure everything there.

strats.name: Spring Ball
strats.note: Use SpringBall to get up and over the Fune.

strats.name: Morph Bombs
strats.note: Use a Morph Bomb to get up and over the Fune.

strats.name: Fireflea Room Fune Boost
note: A well-done mid-air morph can get up and over the Fune using the boost from a projectile hit.
This leads to a softlock if it's the only way in, because it doesn't work on the way out.

strats.name: Norfair Fireflea Bug Boost
note: It's precise, and could only be needed if you don't feel like doing a walljump.
But you can dboost off the highest Fireflea if you can set up to get hit at the apex of your jump.

strats.name: Lower Norfair Fireflea IBJ
strats.note: Made a notable strat because the dismount is trickier than most.

strats.name: Lower Norfair Fireflea Hjless Walljump
strats.note: Left as its own, notable strat because it can be kind of tricky.

strats.name: Spring Ball
strats.note: Use SpringBall to get up and over the Fune.

strats.name: Morph Bombs
strats.note: Use a Morph Bomb to get up and over the Fune.

rooms.name: Lower Norfair Spring Ball Maze Room

nodes.name: Bottom Door
nodes.note: The vertical door at the far right

nodes.name: Right Door
nodes.note: The horizontal, right door at the bottom of the room

nodes.name: Missile (lower Norfair above fire flea room)
Junction Past the Bomb Blocks
nodes.note: This junction is just after the bomb blocks inside the Morph maze.

strats.name: Hotarubi Special
strats.note: Involves doing a speedball then using Spring Ball to break the bomb blocks.

to.note: This one-way link represents only the Hotarubi Special. Anything else should go 1-> 4-> 5.

rooms.name: Lower Norfair Escape Power Bomb Room

nodes.name: Power Bomb (lower Norfair above fire flea room)

strats.name: Base
note: Just reaching the node would be doable in 50 frames.
We have 100 here because getting into the door takes a bit more time than that.

runways.note: This longer runway is not usable if the shot blocks are destroyed.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: There's technically a bomb block to break, but it's impossible to reach this node without destroying it beforehand.
